sentence.Network_en: Concurring with expectations, the degree of polymorphism was highest in the central.
sentence.Network_cn: 正如所料, 多型性程度在中部种群中最高.

sentence.Network_en: The more an affect arises from a number of causes concurring together, the greater it is.
sentence.Network_cn: 同时凑合起来以激起一个情感的原因愈多, 则这个情感将必愈大.

list.abs: this summer two weeks of rain concurred with our vacation ., 今年 , 我们两个星期的假期里每天都下雨.
concur-英汉词典-英中字典-速译通-解释意思... ... concurring opinion {n.}并存意见 concurring vote {n.}同意票.
clinical assessment of dynamic concur tonometer ., 动态轮廓眼压计的临床应用.
第二是部分法官的并存意见(concurring opinion)，提出并存意见的法官虽然赞成多数派法官的判决意见，但是提出不同的推论或理由。
... at 762 (克拉克法官持同意意见).译者注，同意意见（concurring opinion）指支持判决结果的意见，异议意见（dissenting opinion） …

entry.def: If one person concurs with another person, the two people agree. You can also say that two people concur .

example.ex: Local feeling does not necessarily concur with the press...
example.tran: 当地人的感受未必与媒体一致。

example.ex: Daniels and Franklin concurred in an investigator's suggestion that the police be commended...
example.tran: 丹尼尔斯和富兰克林一致同意一位调查人员的建议，即警方应该受到赞扬。

auth_sentence.content: Lord Justice Etherton delivered a concurring judgment.

auth_sentence.content: Lord Hope, Lord Mance and Lord Reed delivered concurring judgments.
